snippet: Former Prime Ministers Morihiro Hosokawa and Junichiro Koizumi are trying to turn the election for Tokyo governor on Sunday into a referendum on the future of nuclear power in Japan.
abstract: Polls and political analysts say former Japanese Prime Mins Morihiro Hosokawa and Junichiro Koizumi have not yet been able to persaude enough voters to back their quixotic bid against nuclear power; two former leaders have tried to turn a gubernatorial race in Tokyo into what they call Japan's first referendum on the future of nuclear power since the Fukushima nuclear power plant accident.
lead_paragraph: Former Prime Ministers Morihiro Hosokawa and Junichiro Koizumi are trying to turn the election for Tokyo governor on Sunday into a referendum on the future of nuclear power in Japan.

headline.main: 2 Former Premiers Try to Use Tokyo Election to Rally Public Against Nuclear Power
headline.print_headline: 2 Former Premiers Try to Use Tokyo Election to Rally Public Against Nuclear Power
